t: Job 37
Elihu Says God Is Back of the Storm
“At*pn this also my heart trembles, And*ln leaps from its place.
Listen*ln closely to the thunder of His voice, And*ln the rumbling that goes out from His mouth.
Under*ln the whole heaven He lets it loose, And*ln His lightning to the ends of the earth.
After*ln it, a voice roars; He*ln thunders with His majestic voice, And*ln He does not restrain the lightnings when His voice is heard.
God*ln thunders with His voice wondrously, Doing*ln great things which we cannot comprehend.
For*ln to the snow He says, ‘Fall on the earth,’ And*ln to the downpour and the rain, ‘Be strong.’
He*ln seals the hand of every man, That*ln all men may know His work.
Then*ln the beast goes into its lair And*ln remains in its den.
Out*ln of the south comes the storm, And*ln out of the north the cold.
From*ln the breath of God ice is made, And*ln the expanse of the waters is frozen.
Also*ln with moisture He loads the thick cloud; He*ln disperses the cloud of His lightning.
It*ln changes direction, turning around by His guidance, That*ln it may do whatever He commands it On*ln the face of the inhabited earth.
Whether*ln for correction, or for His world, Or*ln for lovingkindness, He causes it to happen.
“Listen*ln to this, O Job, Stand*ln and consider the wonders of God.
Do*ln you know how God establishes them, And*ln makes the lightning of His cloud to shine?
Do*ln you know about the layers of the thick clouds, The*ln wonders of one perfect in knowledge,
You*ln whose garments are hot, When*ln the land is still because of the south wind?
Can*ln you, with Him, spread out the skies, Strong*ln as a molten mirror?
Teach*ln us what we shall say to Him; We*ln cannot arrange our*i case*i because of darkness.
Shall*ln it be told Him that I would speak? Or*ln should a man say that he would be swallowed up?
“Now*ln men do not see the light which is bright in the skies; But*ln the wind has passed and cleared them.
Out*ln of the north comes golden splendor;*i Around*ln God is awesome majesty.
The*ln Almighty—we cannot find Him; He*ln is exalted in power And*ln He will not do violence to justice and abundant righteousness.
Therefore*ln men fear Him; He*ln does not regard any who are wise of heart.”
